titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Penn Museum 29-201-709: Sharḥ Qaṣīdat al-Burdah

notesStmt.note: Modern pagination added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.
Dimensions of original manuscript: 205 x 150 (140 x 100) mm bound to 205 x 153 mm.

msIdentifier.repository: University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology

msContents.summary: Manuscript containing three texts, copied in three different hands. The first work is a commentary on the poem known as al-Burdah by al-Būṣīrī, the second is a response by al-Suyūṭī to questions about the Ḥadīth and the third is a set of poems and Ḥadīth excerpts.

author.persName: Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, 1213?-1296?
بوصيري، شرف الدين محمد بن سعيد،

msItem.title: [Selections of poetry and excerpts from Ḥadīth]

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 23-26 long lines with poetry in two staggered lines; ruled with a misṭarah.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in maghribī in dark brown ink; pointed and vocalized.

binding.p: Bound in red leather with flap (Type II); blind-tooled frame with foliate blind-stamped outer frame and a centrally placed diamond made up of five small flower stamps and eight smaller circle with radiant lines stamps; the same small flower stamps appear in the corners of the inner frame and on the flap.

origin.p: Copy of the main text completed on 4 Jumadá al-Ūlá 1196 AH (5 February 1782) (p.; third work copied by [?] ibn Fātiḥ, the name has been crossed out by a later reader (p. 149).

history.provenance: Acquired during the Expedition in Morocco by Talcott Williams and Sophia Wells Royce Williams, 1898.

surface.n: Inside back cover flap open to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
Fore edge flap closed, inside front cover
